It is a truly heart warming story that is fantasy yet serious at the same time. It showed us great friendships throughout the story. 


In my opinion, this anime is one of the best. 


So give it a try and see if you like it or not. Oh and, remember to watch each season by orders(Don't be like me!). Yup, I watched season 2 first then I realized that it is season 2, not one.

Natsume, a young highschool boy with the 'gift' of seeing spirits since he was a child. The anime shows the events that unfold since he moved from the city to a country town to live with his distant relatives due to various circumstances, as well as revealing Natsume's past as he goes through his everyday life. However what makes this anime so great, is possibly simply the atmosphere of the anime itself. The anime is written superbly, the writers are able to create an anime which gives a relaxing feel while watching; as well as being entertaining. The anime does not have a linear plotor goal of any sort, which is rare for its genre of drama. Although it lacks any obvious story-line, it is obvious that after watching this anime, the writers goal was simply to take viewers on a journey through a kind hearted boys life; as he discovers more and more about himself as well has his ability to see spirits which he as always felt burdened by, he discovers that not all spirits are cruel, but some are loving, even more so than those who are living around him.\n\n
This anime deserves much more praise than i am giving it, being able to reach the heart of the viewers with each and every episode. Therefore it would be more than fair to say this anime deserves nothing less than 10/10.

Well this anime was thoroughly enjoyable, it's anime style is good, the voices seem to go with the characters and the development of the characters was pretty good. There is a sequel to this which is equally enjoyable so far. I think this anime would be suitable for a pretty big audience, but mostly those who like the genres: slice of like (not too much of that thrown in there) supernatural, comedy and drama.
Overall this was a great anime and I hope it turns out so for others.

After watching XXXHolic, i've really enjoyed more of the animes with stories other than mechas, super powers, and other narrow-storied shows.  Natsume and Zoku Natsume are great because of their slice of life/supernatural air.  I originally put this on my list to grab and share, but I ended up watching one episode and was hooked.  Definitely worth watching.

8/1/10
Natsume Yuujincho, in my opinion, was a wonderful anime.  There is really no actual objective in this anime (Example: trying to find a person etc.) Which in my opinion could make the anime even better, but it's a give and take situation because what it lacks in a plot it makes up in some really detailed scenery. The characters in themselves were simple yet were really nicley drawn. I thought there was a lot of sound, and there really wasn't a lot of main characters, but had a lot of side characters that appereared in only one episode. All in all, this anime waswonderfull, and I loved it so much I finished all 26 episodes in 3 days. o^.^o

The overall feel of Natsume Yuujinchou always leaves you satisfied after an episode. It has some type of charm about it, as well as Natsume himself. The relationship he has with the demons as well as Madara (Nyanko) is what really made me enjoy. I always love animes that have good chemistry amongst themselves, as well as having substance.
It's a really good watch and unless you absolutely need non stop action then you will enjoy Natsume Yuujinchou.

I could tell that Natsume Yuujinchou is anime which grabs my heart. I'm going to watch the 4th season today (And I started watching before two days). It's anime full of feelings, friendship and especially fantasy things. I can just recommend you to watch it...because it has a beautiful message inside and it's up to you if you notice it or not.
Story: Yeah, there have been lots of anime about yokai and ayakashi...but this one decribes friendship and hatred among people and yokai.
Art: I have nothing to say. It's easy to get used to this art. Especially I like how unrealisticaly are reflected.
Sound is beautiful...especiallyopenings.\n
Character: Every yokai...Every person in this anime has something ...something special...typical for them.\n\n
I can just say that I enjoyed this anime pretty much...and now I'm going to watch the last season. Hope you will watch it and you will like it so much as I do :)

Natsume Yuujinchou is from a genre I previously had not tested very much, thinking I wouldn't like the slower pacing of a show like this. However, I was completely, and happily surprised by it.
Story: 9. The story is based around a young high school male named Natsume who can see ayakashi. One day he ends up accidentally breaking a seal on a shrine, releasing an extremely powerful demon... who is trapped in the body of what looks like a Lucky Cat statue. He becomes Natsume's bodyguard, and goes by the term "Nyanko-sensei," helping Natsume in his adventures. Natsume meets and helps a variety of ayakashiand humans.


Art: 8. Standing by itself, I would typically give this art a nine, but if you look at the later seasons, it just doesn't hold up. However, the art is simply beautiful, plain and simple.


Sound: 8. I don't feel like there are any major problems with the sound, I just wished there was more of a background track in some places, and to be honest I dislike the ending.


Characters: 9. With so many characters in thirteen episodes, it makes creating the breadth of characters they did truly amazing. I completely respect the creators, and with each character I feel attached and feel they bring something new that I haven't seen before. I love the way characters are animated in this show, and how their facial expressions subtly change. The only reason I don't give it a 10 is because many of the male characters look extremely feminine.... a bit interesting but... makes the variation lack somewhat.


Enjoyment: 9. I love this show, I really do. There's something that made me not enjoy it nearly as much as I do other things, to be honest, and that was a friend of mine complaining through it the whole time.


Overall: 8. I recommend this show to every single person who likes anime. It's gorgeous, the story is wonderful, and the more I watch, the more I love. Definitely continue on with the other three seasons if you like it, because Natsume is worth it.

[Short Reviewer]
I will try to keep all reviews short, simple, and straight to the point. 
A pleasant surprise in my backlog of anime.
Story: 9
Natsume Yuujinchou doesn't really have a consistent story. Each episode is pretty much self contained though  some of the characters appear in other stories its never really major. So while the synopsis will have you believe that Natsume is bound to this book and trying hard to return all these names to spirits  its not really the case. He meets spirits along the way and willingly or reluctantly he decides to help them out with their problems. Every story issad in one way or another but they're usually resolved with happy endings. All are unique and very heart warming.\n
I'm a sucker for romance and am always looking for it in anime and  unfortunately this has none. Sorry.\n\n
Art/Animation :7\n
It's very simple and clean.Nothing is ever too detailed or beautiful but you can tell this  had a strict budget so they used a lot of color to mask it and it works. It solid art and animation but nothing mind blowing. Character designs is pretty average unfortunately.\n\n
Sound: 7\n
OP is weak. ED is different from what I'm used to but I really liked it. All the VA is solid and while the actual songs aren't memorable they work.\n\n
Character: 8\n
Most characters are nothing special but the spirits are definitely the highlight of the anime. As well as having their own stories they have a lot of personality to them. In my opinion they are the main attraction of the entire anime. You don't really care about Natsume returning the names or his future but the stories of all the spirits and how sad or amazing the next one is going to be.\n\n
Overall:8\n
While it's the actual stories that drive the anime, the production side of things hold me back from giving it an 9 or 10. I love music, its a big part of anime in my opinion and so is the animation and art. Sadly both of them don't stand out in this anime. If neither of those things matter to you and you're into anime strictly for story Natsume Yuujinchou will not disappoint its a great anime especially for anyone looking for something a little different and relaxing.

I’ve been in love with Japan for a long time and supernatural series is one of my most favorite genres of all so Japanese Folklore is really one of my addictions. It’s not only scary but more importantly, it has unexplainable sophistication to it. Among the folklores stories I’ve encountered, the Japanese is the most interesting, very knowledgeable, exciting, mysterious, and you can really see the Japanese pride on it.
There’s a long review coming………….
About the STORY
Japanese Folklore is one of the commonly used elements in supernatural series. Well, that’s granted because manga and anime are JAPANESE. However, only very few can really showcase the greatnessof this type of genre. Some would be too scary and some would be too boring. The plot can be considered as cliché but how it’s reinvented is no doubt amazingly done. It is somewhat episodic so every new episode comes with so much excitement and anticipation. The supernatural element is done nicely so it is not scary to the point of being over the top because if it’s too much, the mysteriousness will lose its greatness and would be just SCARY alone. Much like how Mushishi was done. The scary and creepy part is not overwhelming the mystery part which I think is very important because supernatural should not always be necessarily horror. It’s more on the mystery of it which makes it very interesting. The drama is not overly done and can be really touching. You could say every element of the story is well-balanced so the result is one amazing story. But more than being exciting, every story is heart-warming, touching, and inspiring. 


About the CHARACTERS

The characters are very interesting; be it humans or supernatural beings. The assortment of supernatural creatures whether they are bad or good are very interesting which make the story very exciting. I really love the character of Natsume’s Grandmother, Reiko, who started all and the one responsible why there is a story in the first place. Instead of hating herself, she finds a way to help the creatures which make her much stronger than Natsume. And even though she acts like she’s putting a fight with the creatures and collects their names, the truth is, she’s actually helping them that shows how much she treasures the beings in that world. While Natsume’s is gradually accepting the supernatural beings, they are also gradually learning that not all humans are bad.


About MADARA/NYANKO-SENSEI

Nyanko-sensei is one of the best characters in my list and of course, one of the cutest. He is so hilarious with all of his antics. Though, he started with motives on why he approaches Natsume, he also gradually gets fond of him. Throughout the series, he would often say that he’s just using Natsume but deep down, he already cares a lot for him. I just love their unique yet complicated relationship. Because of their relationship, Natsume learns to love the other world and Nyanko-sensei gets fond of the human beings as well.


About NATSUME TAKASHI

Natsume’s character is probably one of the most cliché types. However, this type of character is always a sure hit because it is always inspiring to see characters that started off with hating themselves because of their difference from others but throughout the series learns to accept it. He is weak at the beginning and very alone because of his abilities but improves a lot as the story progresses. Instead of considering his abilities as a curse, I am so glad that he learns to consider it as a gift. Because hating ones true self is like denying who you really are. He finally finds joy in the world different from most people and truly treasures it which I think the very reason why his character gradually improves and so he gets stronger and stronger as the episodes goes by. And that’s not just physically but more importantly his whole being as well.


About the ANIMATION and SOUNDS

The animation is nice and the illustration of the supernatural beings might be somewhat common but it still made as original as possible and very nice. The landscapes are also great. Hiroshi Kamiya is perfect for the character’s voice. He is so amazing when it comes to monologues and delivering very nice lines. The great sounds make the series even more amazing. It becomes a lot more heart-warming and touching, most especially the ending theme.


Now, who said serious supernatural series can’t be fun at the same time? You will have mix emotions watching this series. You will laugh, cry, be scared, get excited, touch, inspired, and amazed. This is a very good example of an amazing series which resulted from the combination of episodic and supernatural. It doesn’t have a heavy and spectacular plot like those of famous animes but it is no doubt an amazing series which will make you want for more.
